headline: Analyst Salary
pros: Organized, smart, great reputation and specialists

headline: Horrific culture, decent pay
pros: Boutique bank setting allows for more ownership and client interaction, decent compensation at Associate level and above
cons: No collaboration, inconsistent messaging from Principals (even though there's only 5 of them), extreme egos leading to unhealthy level of internal competition, more than 35 turnovers in less than 3 years (historically, largest the firm has been was <60 total employees)

headline: Good place to learn
pros: Fantastic comp, great culture, lots of learning opportunities
cons: Not really, IB culture itself is tough, so long hours are nothing new

headline: Don't work here
pros: Great pay out of college. You are a banker.
cons: Terrible work environment. Will not learn much. Extremely poor exit opps

headline: Investment Banking Analyst
pros: Some of the Associates really take the time in teaching you
cons:
Inadequate training
Below street comp
Senior banker heavy, not enough juniors to support
Unnecessary uptight work culture
Bonus is subjective, analysts are at the bottom of the totem pole relative to non-revenue generating MDs
Not the best exits
